channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: There’s a small problem with Trump’s export deal with Nvidia and AMD: The Constitution says it’s illegal
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: BlackRock’s Rick Rieder says this is the ‘best investing environment ever’ — he’s conveniently in the running for next Fed chairman
item.description: While Rieder's dovish stance aligns with President Trump’s, the BlackRock exec's acknowledgment of tariff-driven inflation may test his appeal to the ...

item.title: Israeli Settlers Unleash Record High Attacks in West Bank
item.description: Extremists are carrying out one of the most violent campaigns against Palestinian villages since the U.N. began keeping records.

item.title: Russia Steps Up Its Battlefield Attacks, and America’s Drinking Drops to Record Low
item.description: Plus, a C.I.A. secret up for auction.

item.title: Singapore transport operator ComfortDelGro now generates more revenue from overseas than its home base
item.description: Revenue from operations in the UK, Europe, Australia, New Zealand, and China now make up more than 50% of the Singapore transport operator's revenue.

item.title: Startup down rounds are at a 10 year high, according to PitchBook data
item.description: PitchBook data revealed that 15.9% of venture-backed deals in 2025 to date have been down rounds, marking a decade high.

item.title: Crime Keeps Falling. Here’s Why.
item.description: Reflections on social cohesion and law enforcement can help policymakers reduce crime even further.

item.title: Alaska’s Ukrainian Refugees Brace for Putin’s Arrival in Their Safe Harbor

item.title: How a Call From Trump Ignited a Frantic Week of Diplomacy by Ukraine

item.title: How China Went From Clean Energy Copycat to Global Innovator
item.description: A surge in high quality research and patent applications has cemented China’s dominance in the industry.

item.title: Elon Musk broadens his long-running feud with OpenAI’s Sam Altman by bringing in a third party: Apple
item.description: Musk is unhappy with how Apple is promoting ChatGPT, a rival to his own Grok.
